Paris region inaugurates its first cable car
Subhead: The C1 cable car line opened on December 13, connecting the south-eastern Paris suburbs of Créteil and Villeneuve-Saint-Georges. This new mode of urban transport is attracting the interest of many local governments.

Title: France moves to phase out support system for Ukrainian refugees
Shooting at Brown University kills at least two, injures others
Germany says it has foiled a potential 'Islamist' plot to attack a Christmas market
Subhead: Authorities said they had arrested five men on suspicion of a plot to plow a vehicle into a Christmas market. It was unclear where the attack was supposed to take place or which market was to be targeted.

Title: US troops and civilian in Syria killed in IS ambush attack
Subhead: Two American troops and a civilian were killed in central Syria on Saturday after an alleged member of the Islamic State group opened fire on a joint US-Syrian patrol, officials said. Donald Trump promised retaliation.

Title: Sant Ambroeus brings Italian flair to Paris's Latin Quarter
Subhead: The New York café-restaurant frequented by celebrities has opened a new location in the elegant Saint-Germain-des-Prés district, offering an Italian-American menu in an atmosphere inspired by the 1930s.

Title: 'La Cage aux Folles': Paris reclaims the flamboyant musical
Subhead: French audiences mostly know 'La Cage aux Folles' from the film adaptation of Jean Poiret's play, featuring Michel Serrault's exuberant performance. But it is also a triumphant Broadway classic, freed from clichés about homosexuality. Now, director Olivier Py and actor Laurent Lafitte bring the musical to the Théâtre du Châtelet in Paris.

Paris Agreement: Ten years later, key players look back on 'incredible alignment of stars'
Subhead: Le Monde takes a look back at the the signing of the Paris Agreement in the French capital on December 12, 2015, a major geopolitical agreement reached after two weeks of intense negotiations that aimed to limit global warming to 'well below' 2°C and at 'pursuing efforts' to keep the temperature increase to 1.5°C.

Title: The mysterious 'knocker' scaring elderly women in a Brittany town
Subhead: For more than two years, a prowler has been knocking on doors and shutters during the night in a village in Brittany, France, creating a climate of fear among his preferred targets: elderly women. Authorities were slow to take the case seriously.

Title: The poignant testimonies of Russian soldiers returning from Ukraine
Subhead: 'My Undesirable Friends: Part I − Last Air in Moscow,' a film by two independent Russian journalists from Novaya Gazeta, gives voice to 18 soldiers returning from the front. Far from spouting Kremlin propaganda, they express their doubts. In just six months, the documentary has been viewed 1.5 million times in Russia.
